comment: He was an OK professor but his lectures were all over the place! He doesn't use a mic and speaks in a dull voice which is very hard to hear. He doesn't keep up with due dates for assignments and the deadlines are in weird times like 10am on a Sunday. Exams are also structured weird because somethings are not covered but goodluck if you take him lol

He is a nice guy and he's funny, but he is an extremely tough grader. There are 4 exams, and a final, each worth 100 points with the other assignments (homework, discussions, etc) being worth 200 points. He does not allow a notecard for exams. Cool guy but the class was hard.

do NOT take him for bio 1108, he didnt teach AT ALL, would just read very dull off the slides and get very off topic- he wouldn't update his class if anything happened so it would come off as a surprise. tests were REALLY hard and over topics he never went over (he said it himself too) just save yourself the time and dont take him for bio
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It was his first time teaching 1108, so if you take him for this class, be patient with him. He was adjusting this semester, so our practice would have odd due times and not all grades were put in. That taken into account, I liked him a lot. He did a great job considering being assigned to teach it 3 days in advance.

I wouldn't recommend taking 1108 with him. It was his first time teaching the course, and it felt very unorganized. He mostly read from PowerPoints, which made lectures dull. Homework was assigned randomly with odd due times, and the study guides didn't match the material. He's a nice guy, but the class was rushed and chaotic.

DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR BIOLOGY 1108! He is VERY disorganized and only lectures from the PowerPoints. He assigns homework at the most random times and we have to email him every week for him to fix the due dates. Does not give any class work or projects. Tests are on paper and very difficult. Very old school. He's nice but not a good professor.

Going to lectures, usage of the textbook, & reviewing slides all help comprehend the material & vocabulary. Before buying see the textbk he uses. There were four projects that showed up on exams. Exam questions cover a lot of ground using applications-based, multiple-choice options that sound similar so study hard. He is approachable for questions.

avoid this guy if you care about your grade. he comes off as a nice guy but grading and assignments are a whole different story. he made this lab 2x harder than lecture and the assignments were very convoluted. very stat heavy. His expectations and assignments that's given to us is like were professionals or graduate students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: He seems to like what he teaches but wow the lectures are boring but not required. He takes attendance randomly but usually not until halfway through the class. Just read over slides before tests and you should be fine. Also graded with online hw but its simple. Boring but if this class doesn't concern your major then take it since its an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nice guy. I feel like if I was taking a class in his preferred study of biology he would've been great. The class size was huge and it was all lecture so I personally struggled to stay focused, but he does offer extra credit. He has labs for the class, but they don't have to be turned in, he just has questions about them on the exam so that's nice.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Mutchler is funny and entertaining. He obviously cares a lot about his students and their successes. However, this is not an easy A- he makes you really learn and understand the content in depth, and the tests are pretty hard. His lectures and the textbook are used heavily on quizzes and in reports. Study hard and go to class!
as long as you do the labs, homework, and keep up with notes you'll likely pass with a B. textbook is required, three mid-terms, attendance is semi-mandatory.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly it wasnt a bad class but he gave quizzes every three days and the lectures were long. If you pay attention and turn in everything on time, it should be an easy A. He does a good job at explaining the concepts in his lectures but you mostly just have to study every single day. I personally considered it an easy class.

he's not a bad guy but this class was absolutely horrifying this summer. I will never do this again, so much reading and only give you like 2 days til a quiz is due! Never prepared for the test cuz I spend all week trying to finish notes. I do all his study guides and he always make the qs on the exam applicable and I fail every time smh
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I usually don't write ratings for professors, but don't take this class and save yourself. The quizzes slip in trick questions and you only have 20 minutes for 10 questions, which seems enough at first but it flies. He takes this online class way too seriously for a basic science class. If you want your life to be all about science take him.

8 week summer course. Short windows to complete assignments. 2 assignments a week 3 and 4 day windows. Tons of reading. So far not many recorded lectures. Work load is pretty vast, but for a gen ed course it is a little ridiculous. Would not suggest taking this class as part of a full course load. Likely will get a B, but having to work very hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Mutchler is a great guy, really funny and personable but beware- I wouldn't call this an "easy a" class. I'm not sure how this class works in a COVID-free world, but the course load is pretty hefty in terms of readings, notes, and online labs- If you don't study, you will NOT do well on the weekly quizzes- lots of extra credit offered

Was initially worried because of the past reviews for him, but he's a good choice for ecology. He tests your understanding of the material (not simple memorization), so be sure to really study for this class. Lectures were interesting and plenty of time given for the tests. Got a B because of one bad test grade so don't slack.

I enjoyed his class and he made the lectures easy to follow but his tests were not like the examples given in class. The questions on the test were alot of application and were not fair. There was many q's to interpret graphs. I just barely passed with A but was the hardest one I had to work for. Studied alot over ppts
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: My man Troy Mutchler is an unforgettable personality even a year later. He's goofy and caring in his classes and doesn't make the class unnecessarily hard.

I took this class online in 8 weeks, and got an A. There is a lot of reading but it's doable, i.e. I work full-time, and took another online class, and still managed. Everything is laid out clearly and he is organized. He's got videos to go along with the reading which also helps in remembering the material for quizzes and tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was okay. Tests and quizzes will be hard if you dont read the textbook so read it! I didnt start actually reading until about halfway through and my grades started to get better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Mutchler is not a bad professor, he gives a decent amount of easy extra credit opportunities. His exams and quizzes do require lockdown browser. The way he words some of his quiz/test questions can be confusing and unnecessarily difficult. Most of the subject in this class you probably already learned in high school, easy B.

Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy grade. The quizzes are on lock down browser and they are so hard with a lot of unnecessary words. He doesn't stay in contact with the class if you are taking it online. You will have to study for a long time just to remember basic answers.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Basic course that was unnecessarily hard. Insanely difficult quizzes on Lockdown Browser. Forced to study 5 hours each day for a weekly 10 question quiz. There was no communication, no instruction, and no guidance. Be prepared to work harder than you've ever worked, more than likely for a low overall grade. Hardest class I've ever taken

I would never take professor Mutchler's class again. I took this class online and he gives a lot of busy work and the labs are unclear. All test and quizzes are monitored through Lockdown Browser, the professor seems distant when trying to contact him and he does not care about you failing his class and don't even mention extra credit.

He is a really good professor and wants everyone to do good. He's funny and tries to make the lectures as fun as possible. 4 tests and homework online which is really easy and helpful. He explains everything well and gives you everything you need to do good on test.

Take this class if you enjoy a fun, very chill and casual learning environment. He created an open environment where everyone feels comfortable to be a part of the conversation. Not a lot of homework, 30-45min a week, no reading. Makes learning pretty dry stuff fun and interactive. Tests are scantrons, and pretty easy as long as you study.

DO NOT take this as an eight week class. The amount of information required to learn in a 3-4 day time period is overwhelming. Quizzes 2 times a week, and a test every 3 quizzes. All of your time will be devoted to this one class. Class averages for quizzes was between 60 & 70. There is a good opportunity for extra credit.
This class is honestly too much to take during a summer semester. Entirely too much work in a span of 3 days for each lesson. Too many videos, really long labs, all for a short quiz.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class online and wouldn't recommend it. There were powerpoints, websites, book readings, labs, and videos he gave us to study. All this info boiled down to a 10 question quiz each week. The comments about them are accurate. However, the tests are much easier than the quizzes. I had to work way too hard for a B in this class.

I took this class online and I must say this was the most difficult class I have taken thus far. The course was all over the place, the labs were unclear, and he thinks that his class is the only class were taking. Do yourself a favor and take the class on campus rather than online.

He is an interesting person and he really cared about how his students were doing in his class. Like we could all tell he was sad about bad grades. He is always willing to help anyone and very reliable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: BRO take this guy!! Always lets you out of lab early, super caring, wants you to understand what you're doing, helps you as much as you need but also lets you do your own stuff! All around super cool guy. You'll get an A as long as you show up and pay attention!

If your plan is to take this online class, DON'T. He seems like a nice guy, but the weekly quizzes are extremely difficult and almost impossible to pass. I studied for hours and made Quizlets with 50 questions/terms each and would still fail the quizzes/tests. They are also on Lock down Browser with Webcam, so that makes it even worse.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: His class is super easy and he cares about his students. All his powerpoints are online and the tests are exactly whats on the powerpoints and the labs. Attendance isnt taken or mandatory. I only showed up on test days, super easy A.

I didn't do any of the labs and did not make it to every day of class and still passed. If you can stand painfully boring lectures, go with Troy. He will talk to you if you have an issue. A nice guy, but could use a but of excitement. Do the few discussion posts and extra credit and the online homework and you should be fine.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Mutchler is very good at what he does. Although a lecture hall with over 200 students can get pretty boring he does find ways to keep it interesting. You are graded on 3 tests, and online modules due before every test. DO THE LABS he assigns because you will see questions about them on your tests.

I worked so hard in this class. We were given many homework assignments weekly that didnt really count for anything, followed by a weekly quiz that covered some material we had learned, some that we hadnt. Lectures are long and dry. I am not a science fan so I wasnt surprised that I didnt like the class, but I found this one overly challenging.

Three exams, online labs, and a final. The material itself is very basic, same stuff we have been learning for years. Professor Mutchler is very boring and presents info on white, blank powerpoints. The material was easy, but going to class was painful due to boredom. Professor Mutchler does a terrible job engaging the class too.

The first day of classes, he said that he had not taught a face-to-face class in 10 years and let me tell you, it showed. He lectures from the beginning of class to the end and its full of dry jokes and so much information. Do not take this class. Period. The tests don't make any sense and he isn't much help when you email him. Don't take his class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: There are 4 exams which makeup most of your grade. A couple of discussion posts but they are short and 3 labs per exam but they are not mandatory to do he just puts questions from the labs on the exams. There are also online MES activities. All he does is lecture every class and the lectures are very boring! The exams are also very hard!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Mutchler is a very cool professor except for he lectures every class and his test are very difficult. You also have online labs each unit which are very difficult. As long as you study really hard and pay attention in class then you should do fine.

I am an A student but not for this class. I passed all the assignments and discussions with 100% but quizzes have nothing to do over assignments or discussion. I would read the require chapters and still bomb. Sometimes even his questions didn't make sense. He even emailed me once saying C is standard for his class... I don't want C's.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very easy, low-stress science class if you don't procrastinate. Read and do the mastering activities and you should do well on the quizzes. Use the study guide for the test. He posts powerpoints and online labs (they aren't graded). Lockdown browser, but no camera used. Quizlet and Google helped with mastering, quizzes, and tests!

I took dr. mutchler for the belize marine bio trip and he was good. his lectures are great but he doesn't upload info to d2l so definitely take detailed notes. it's not always clear what he takes off points for on tests and written assignments. nice guy, responds quickly to emails, willing to explain concepts further in class if needed
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I am not a science person and took this class online- finished with an A. However, I had to work extremely hard. Read all textbook chapters and unit information. Do your study guides and STUDY! He drops the lowest test grade and there is some extra credit. You must understand the concepts and all information that goes with the unit- hard tests!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Mutchler cares about his students and the quality of materials. The quiz and exam questions were way more in-depth than a general-ed class should be. He basically asked us to apply concepts that were just learned. He realized that this was an issue and made the correction right away. Albeit it is a hard class, I would take it again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Mutchler was kind and provides some opportunities for extra credit. You have three units that consist of different modules. Each has a lab, quiz, and homework - only two discussion posts during the semester. I competed everything and studied, but the quizzes felt like they came from left field.

Online class that I thought would be a lot easier. Class has 3 test he drops your lowest. 10 quizzes he drops 2 lowest. 3 discussion post. Class I thought would be easy but he makes up the test. I am going to make an A but just a quizlet online class.

Online. His tests will give you nightmares. He is very much about "understanding concepts" so instead of knowing definitions and overall general ideas, he expects you to have thorough knowledge to the point where you could turn around and teach it to someone. Nothing was on quizlet, study guide was useless. The average was a C on all tests.

Lots of reading and powerpoints. Tests and quizzes are really hard. He drops 2 quizzes and 1 test though so that helps. He's easily accessible and responds pretty quickly. Mastering assignments are easy and quick, they help some.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took this class online, and Im not going to lie the tests and quizzes are pretty difficult. You can pass, and even get an A, if you do the homework, and use quizlet. The professor himself is like any other online teacher. Little communication, but accessible if needed.

1 quiz per week, 3 exams, then a cumulative final. The quizzes are hard and it often could be two answers. You have to apply the knowledge I wrote pages of notes word for word from the textbook and then searched keywords and still couldn't find the answers. It was impossible for me to get above a B on anything.

I took him online for the summer. You have to really study for his exams. You can't search them in google or quizlet. I made B's on every exam. However, if you do well and make good grades on the quizzes and decently well on the discussions, you can possible make an A. I made a 91 and I put in somehwat of an effort.

I hated this class, but just because the subject was already my least favorite. There was a ton of busywork and I don't feel like I really learned anything. However, Mutchler offered a lot of extra credit and dropped a lot of grades, which made a huge difference-- so if you're just taking science because you have to, I'd recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This guy exam is brutal.  For example answer choices will be A.....B....C...D. all the above, E. non of the above and sometimes you'll find two answers in one question. i'm like damn which one is it. ughh its so annoying . Only 3 exams and a final
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: This class is very heavy on quizzes and assignments. Lots to do, and you cant always just google the answers for his quizzes and tests. The book is actually helpful and has a lot of the answers though. Seems like a nice guy though, and he gave us extra credit which was great.

He is not a bad professor, but his tests and quizzes are not easy. I did not study at all for them, so I would think differently if I would have. The mastering activities are easy, but they are not enough to prepare you for the quiz. The mastering activities should count for more than 30 points for all of them considering how many there are.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: HORRIBLE. Never again. His class is soooo boring and the exams are soo hard.

Professor Mutchler cares about his students. He is very accessible although class was online. His tests are a bit hard but if you study enough, you'll do fine. He has his own lectures recorded so that you can listen to him explain everything to you. Only thing I would say is they tend to be really long. So prepare to be sitting there for a bit.

Would not recommend taking Mutchler for ecology. His tests do not represent the material covered In class at all. Said on the first day that the book was useless and then assigned readings from the book for the exam. Gave a test without even being on campus, so we had no way to ask questions. 2/10 WOULD NOT TAKE HIM FOR UPPER LEVEL BIO
Good professor. Well structured course. A lot of work and a lot of reading. Provides one extra credit quiz and drops two lowest quizzes and an exam.
Very easy online class. Quiz once a week and then test every 3 weeks. Discussion posts and of course the Mastering Environmental Assignments. I would take him again if he taught 1102.

Difficult online class. 3 units consisting of 3 quizzes and a test each unit. If you do not do the work, it is impossible to pass. Many videos to watch and readings per unit. That being said, I made an A but did hours of work each week to obtain my grade.
Class is too difficult considering it's a 1000 level course. That being said, I made a B, but I did not try once the whole semester (skipped the labs, BS'd my way through the tests and quizzes).

This is one of the tougher online classes I have taken. The course consists of a weekly quiz, weekly labs, three tests and a final. He gives study guides to his tests but they have almost nothing to do with the actual test itself. You need to understand what you're doing in this class in order to do well. Be prepared to put in some effort.

Best lab professor I've had. He actually facilitates you teaching yourself rather than shoving information down your throat.  Always available during office hours. Must know stats! Not too much outside class work.
Extremely attractive man with a wonderful crude sense of humor :) Very hands off, explains enough for you to understand but allows you to work independently.

The online class was composed of a quiz every week, 3 tests, a final, and two discussion posts. The first test was extremely easy, but they progressively increased in difficulty in my opinion. The best way to handle this class is to get together with other classmates because all exams are THE EXACT SAME QUESTIONS as your fellow classmates.

I liked this online class.  If you actually read the chapters, the tests are not hard at all.  The people who reviewed him previously obviously did not read the material and do the online labs.  I got an A pretty easily and I'm not good at science.

I took him for an online class. He assigns a lot of work for the tests and the tests are super difficult. All the assignments are clear but you definitely have to work hard and do all the work he assigns.

Very hard online course. I typed and studied over an 80 page study guide and still barely made an A. His study guides are nothing like his exams. The wording is horrible on them and it is so difficult to understand. The class was very interesting and I really loved it, just wish the professor had been more involved and more clear.
If you want to FAIL this course take him

Makes the quizzes and tests way harder than they should be for a 1000 level class. If you're looking for an easy A avoid this class like the plague. I will say, however, that he is VERY organized and you will always know what is expected of you. And he offers an extra unit for extra credit. I got a B but really worked for it.
no no no no no no no no no! Save yourself. Makes a BASIC science class  too difficult.
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. I'm taking online class and his quizzes and tests don't match at all with what he taught in his lectures. Don't be another victim from his class for your GPA.

First of all, if you want an A DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. His quizzes and tests are extremely hard. It is just 1101 class and it doesn't need to be that hard. Choose anyone BUT HIM. I promise he is gonna be your GPA destroyer.
First of all, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS if you want an A. His quizzes and tests are super tricky and difficult. I think he didn't have to make this class too hard, but it is tough.

Not as hard as I thought Mutchler would be. He dropped a few quizzes, an exam and I got a grade the high 80s. Lectures were interesting and he explained stuff clearly, but the way he worded his questions made quizzes tricky — still, pay close attention to lectures and you should do fine. He gives lots of material for summer, but very doable.
His test and quizzes are very difficult. The lectures aren't helpful at all when taking the test or quizzes. I would not recommend him.

He is no cakewalk but I made a "b" and I forgot to do 3 quizzes and made a 56 on an exam. It clearly states the guidelines for the class in the syllabus- he lets you drop one quiz and one exam score and offers one extra credit opportunity-- what more do you need? If you adhere to the syllabus and follow instructions and deadlines, you'll be fine.

I will make sure to never take this professor for any other class and will be telling others I know not to take him. His tests and quizzes are confusing and most of the time not related to the notes, lectures, and videos he posts(which he posts A TON of). He also does not look to help students that ask for help.

I studied my butt off & came out with a decent grade but this tool took every opportunity to make his questions VERY unclear. I didn't have a problem with the way he taught or how he organized his class. I did have a problem with his enjoyment of watching his students fail & how he decided to word his assignments. He's unclear and narcissistic.
this class was ok... it is not a lot of work and he has a few opportunities for extra credit.
DO NOT TAKE! Im an A student and will be receiving a C in this class. His tests are extremely confusing and often aren't even related to the lectures/videos he posts.

I cannot for the life of me figure out how to do any better in this class. Studying the book, lectures, extra websites he links to- everything. Yet somehow I can hardly even pass most of the quizzes in here. I've always gotten excellent grades (and didn't just take easy classes, mind you) but I truly fear the result of this one.

Most organized professor I have ever had. He truly is a great teacher of environmental science. Uses lectures, books, MES. No trick to his questions, he just doesn't skip anything. Answers emails/questions quickly. Tough 8 week class, but is manageable with light load. Majority of questions come from his lecture notes, use index for book ?

Took summer online. Great Professor. I highly recommend not taking this class over the summer - no material is left out, it is all packed into 8 weeks and is time consuming. Easy B, challenge for an A. Exam 2 is killer, a lot of class failed so study hard! Extremely nice, does helpful videos (most of material is from his videos). He loves science!

Good professor. There is a lot of material but if you do the work you'll do fine. Took him online and the class is easy to navigate through. Tests are confusing and hard but there are quizzes, and other activities that count towards your grade.I ended up with a B but never made above a 76 on an exam. If youve taken online classes before you do well
Great class. This instructor really knows his stuff. Take notes, and do the study guide, if you do, the tests are easy!

This professor is nice and willing to help. I took him online and the amount to work required is unbelievable. If you take him, do every bit of the reading, videos, and lectures. Exams are difficult. Not an easy A but I   would take him online again. Just be ready for TONS of work. Nice guy though and interesting material. Read through everything!
Hated this professor. I went to every class, took pages upon pages of notes and still didn't pass the class. His lectures were boring and is tests were extremely hard. Would NEVER recommend him.

Dr. Mutchler is amazing. Absolutely loved him. You MUST GO TO LECTURE. If you don't want to go to class, do not take him. I attended every class, took detailed notes, studied before the tests and made an A. His tests can be tricky as he wants you to actually think, not just regurgitate definitions. Put in the work and you'll be rewarded.

Disappointed with my grade, but he's a great professor. The class is comprised of 3 exams and one final. The first 3 exams are worth 100 points and the final is worth 130. I made low B's on all 4 of the exams including the final and still made a C in the class because of how much the final is weighed. Kinda lame if you ask me.

Go to class, take notes, and make sure to DO THE STUDY GUIDE. If you know the study guide, you will do fine. I hardly went to class at all and I just did the study guides before the tests and I got A's and B's. Would recommend. Good professor, knows his stuff.
I did not miss a single class,and took notes in every single class and his tests were still difficult for me. He gives 3 tests and a comprehensive final. Textbook usage is minimal.
Go to class and take notes. This class is easy as long as you do that. Do the study guides he gives and you'll do fine. He's funny and a good teacher. I've enjoyed his class.

I took him for ecology,and refuesd to listen to my friends thinking he is a good guy.I never failed any of my classes I was a Biochem major but because of him I had to drop my major into anything but Biochem didnt want to see his face again

Made a general education class much harder than it needed to be! Obviously knows his stuff, but kind of came across as an arrogant prick from time to time. Study, study, study as his tests are very hard if you don't. If you're looking for an easy A, take someone else! I studied and still got a C.
I am in all upper level classes.  This class is such an easy A!  I hear the freshmen complaining in class all the time.  Just come to class and pay attention, get an A!
Just a warning: while class attendance is not mandatory, you will regret not attending as the tests are fairly difficult and in-depth. Study a lot and you should do fine.

Okay I will tell you how it is: best science teacher, keeps class interesting, test are EXTREMELY EASY, if you go to class and take notes you will do just fine on the tests. Overall, he is such a good professor who is straightforward with what he wants, plus there is a study guide before tests!

Many people thought this class was hard, but i found it to be pretty easy, as long as you attend class and take notes. notes are easy to take because they come from powerpoints. tests can be tricky, but just study the notes ALOT!

Okay I told you that I would keep you posted.  I'm the President's list post from 10/17/10 I was able to pull an A but this class is very hard. I would take another prof. unless you have alot of time to study.  And he is hot.

So I hate science, but I love the way professor mutchler teaches. Yes, he teaches from powerpoints.. get over it. Most professors do. Go to class, go to class, go to class!! I didn't buy the book, just took notes from his PPT's and I've made A's on all 3 tests so far. I would recommend him, he cares about the environment & it's not a boring class

Okay this is the real deal.  I am a 4.0 & on the President's list for 3 straight semesters since starting at KSU. This is my 4th semester & as fine as he is & he is fine...his class is very challenging. I may not make the President's list this semester. With 2 test completed I have an 85. I'll keep you posted. Study, read your book and go to class.
Reads off powerpoints...tests are extremely hard. unaware and he doesn't care about anything your worries of your final grade.

Mutchler was horrible! his exams were so hard! He did not like answers your questions if it was touching what could be on his tests. He clearly had no life because he graded everything with a fine tooth comb. really get ready to either read the book for your grade or just harass him! he read right off of pwpt. and you had no time to write it down!

the worst professor ever,he doesn't know that his exams are so damn hard.He expects you to think like him after you take the notes.My friends were taking other professors and none of them complained like I WAS.I was sleepless when it came preparing for his exams as if its your only class through the whole semester.I hope he wont teach Bio 3370 agai

Mutchler is one of the worst professors I've ever had. He reads off of his powerpts. he does not post them so will have to go to class. He goes extremely fast and you cannot keep up. He has something to write about your short answers or lab reports all the time. never wants to give feedback ahead of time. Tests vary sometimes easier or rally hard

If you're needing Ecology, look elsewhere. Mutchler is friendly as all get out and really wants to help you but he stabs you in the back with his exams. They're made artificially more difficult with "all of the above" and "none of the above" responses being present. Grades reports harshly and is critical of your answers.

I've taken plenty of upper level history classes and this class was the most difficult I've ever taken.  Not because of the subject matter (although the text he teaches from tries to cover too much stuff for an 1101 imo) but because of the wording of his test questions.  If you can get into ANY other 1101 class then do so.  Seriously.  7% A = fail.

Hard class. Questions on test are very nit picky but come from class notes. Power point is not posted online. If you study hard I would expect at least a B. Class in general is interesting. Mutchler is very nice. Don't waste money on book.

Even if you go to class and study constantly, there is no guarantee you'll pass. I went to class every day, took every note he had, studied with a study group for weeks before tests and barely made a C. His test questions can be confusing and the study guides he gives are not helpful. And he's NOT hot.

THIS CLASS IS HARD!! If you registered for this professor you need to drop the class. I went to every class and went to every SI session and studied for hours & still got a D in the class. by far the hardest class ive ever taken. dont take this professor!!

Dr. M is kinda nutty, GO TO CLASS, take good notes, or a camera and take pics of the powerpoints, GOT TO GFO TO CLASS, 3 test and final a few extra credit questions.  I got a easy A, go to SI.  Science isnt easy for some, this class is tough, but I thought it to be fair and Dr.M to be a great teacher.

To do well in this class, you need to attend every SI session, and some of us have jobs. I even had a study group that met SEVERAL TIMES throughout the semester, and we're all still struggling to keep afloat. This class is much harder than a 1101 class should be. Check his statistics on the KSU website, and then take someone else.

terrible teacher, his test are rediculously hard and he words the questions in a way that makes the information impossible to comprehend and answer correctly, he likes questions like all are true except... he is unhelpful and according to statistics only 7% of people make A's in this course, pick another professor...
i wanted to drop his class after the first day but im glad i didnt. he seems scary at first but then he is really cool, funny, and interesting!!!!! take him!

Prof. keeps class of 200 relatively interesting, which is hard for any professor. He knows his biology and he loves his algae! :) He's really laid back and intelligent. 4 lab quizzes and 4 tests that may be tricky for some but I managed to get high A's on them all. Read the book. Definitely recommend!

What probably helped me the most was the SI. She is very helpful! She explains things well and cares about you. If you're struggling and wanting to do good on the tests, go to her sessions. (BTW, she's cute too! :-)  )

in my opinion i believe the class was very easy and i walked away with an A. IF you have a good memory and just print and study his power points you will do fine. I really dont know what everyone is talking about, i thought the class was very easy, and hes straight forward. Hes very easy on the eyes

He wasn't incredibly difficult but you defiantly have to study! I did really well in the beginning but I did poorly on one test and walked away from the class with like and 89ish grade and he didnt offer any extra credit! I didnt use the book at all

Well, i wouldn't say this class is easy. But, he post all his power points online and posts a study guide that is shorter than he used to do. Everything on the test is whats on the study guide. I never went to class and still got a B, but i'm good at teaching myself stuff. If your not, then i wouldn't suggest this professor.

Oh boy.. where to start. Honestly, I have never worked so hard for a grade before. I went to the SI sessions, talked to him numerous times, and studied my butt off and still can't make an A in this class. Unless you have a particular knack for science, do NOT take him. He offers NO extra credit. you either do well or not. Be willing to work.

He's a great teacher! He has a great personality and he obviously love what he does. People say he's hard, but those are the ones who never attended class or studied. Study the power points/study guides and youll do just fine!!

Don't miss a beat with this class.  The rhetoric is extensive and requires a considerable amount of attention.  TIP:  Record the lectures and listen to them in the car, at home or even before going to bed.  Dr. Mutchler is a wonderful teacher but challenging to say the least.  I love it!

Dr. Mutchler is a great professor!! Its true that the class does cover alot of information, but if you attend the SI Sessions and make sure to ask him questions if you're stuck on a subject then you'll have no problem making a good grade in his class :)

I do not think his class was as boring as my Sci1102 teacher.  if you do the study guides thoroughly you will get an A or B in his exams.  Plus he posts all his material on vista before class, so you print it out and don't have to take much notes.  Do the labs, even though he doesn't grade them b/c tests will have some questions about it-Recomended

His lectures are pretty boring but he is really amusing and gets really excited about science. He shows funny you tube videos in relation to the subjects. He is a fun teacher but if you're not into science it might be a little difficult.

His lectures can be tiring, but he has a real passion for science, and he posts all the powerpoints on vista. Also he organizes study guides, etc, by exam, and most of the answers come from the powerpoints. Just do the study guides, study them, and you should do fine.

Okay professor mutchler is a very nice, understanding, and helpful teacher. I do agree with everyone saying that its a lot of material and its TD US. However, if your one of those people that has a good memory then take this class. All the questions on his test come DIRECTLY from what he tells you to study nothing else. EASY A, if you study matrial

The material in this class is very hard and time-consuming to learn, but it is possible. I would definitely come to class, because I think that the material from his lectures are really important for the tests. It's a hard class, but Dr. Mutchler is very patient and helpful and he wants his students to do well. Be prepared to study A LOT!

Mr. Mutchler was a really nice guy and very easy to understand. Unfortunetly, his class was anything but easy. The hardest freshman course I had to take and probably the most difficult SCI1101 teacher. Study guides for tests are always over 6 pages and cover so much material. Tests are almost impossible to get an A on and a B is even hard work!

Nice guy, but this class is insanely hard for a freshman level class. First couple of tests were failed by many.   It's his first semester teaching, and tests got much better over the semester with recommendations from students.Huge amounts of information for each test. I learned alot but would have preferred someone else. Very time intensive class

Dr. Mutchler has a passion for science and is a very nice guy. Unfortunately, his class is unbelievably hard for an 1101 class. It is more like an upper level biology class. 11 page study guides and tests that were so difficult the majority of the class failed them. Making an A is not impossible, but extremely difficult. Hugely time consuming class
